mods.accessCondition: This audio file is the property of the Country Music Hall of Fame® and Museum and may be protected by U.S. and international copyright laws. The file may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed without permission. End users must obtain all required permissions or consents from the owners of such rights. To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: Frank Liddell has produced five Miranda Lambert albums and was the Academy of Country Music's 2012 Producer of the Year. As founder and president of Carnival Music, Liddell published the first #1 hits by songwriters Scooter Carusoe, Natalie Hemby, Troy Jones, David Nail, and Bruce Robison. Texas native Liddell also has produced acclaimed albums by Brandi Carlile, Jack Ingram, Chris Knight, David Nail, Kellie Pickler, Pistol Annies, and Lee Ann Womack (whom he married in 1999). Presented in support of the exhibition Miranda Lambert: Backstage Access.

subject.topic: Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.)
